org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.colgroup

Class ColGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.colgroup.ColGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColGroupUncompressed, ColGroupValue

    public abstract class ColGroup
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Class that stores information about a column group within a compressed matrix block. There are subclasses specific to each compression type.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ColGroup.CompressionType
      Public Group types supported Note For instance DDC is called DDC not DDC1, or DDC2 which is a specific subtype of the DDC.

        public abstract long estimateInMemorySize()
        Note: Must be overridden by child classes to account for additional data and metadata
        Returns:
        an upper bound on the number of bytes used to store this ColGroup in memory.

      • decompressToBlock

        public abstract void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                       int rl,
                                       int ru)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into the specified full matrix block.
        Parameters:
        target - a matrix block where the columns covered by this column group have not yet been filled in.
        rl - row lower
        ru - row upper

      • decompressToBlock

        public abstract void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                       int[] colIndexTargets)
        Decompress the contents of this column group into uncompressed packed columns
        Parameters:
        target - a dense matrix block. The block must have enough space to hold the contents of this column group.
        colIndexTargets - array that maps column indices in the original matrix block to columns of target.

        public static void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                     int colIndex,
                                     List<ColGroup> colGroups)

      • decompressToBlock

        public abstract void decompressToBlock(MatrixBlock target,
                                       int colpos)
        Decompress to block.
        Parameters:
        target - dense output vector
        colpos - column to decompress, error if larger or equal numCols

      • getExactSizeOnDisk

        public abstract long getExactSizeOnDisk()
        Returns the exact serialized size of column group. This can be used for example for buffer preallocation.
        Returns:
        exact serialized size for column group

      • get

        public abstract double get(int r,
                           int c)
        Get the value at a global row/column position.
        Parameters:
        r - row
        c - column
        Returns:
        value at the row/column position

      • getValues

        public abstract double[] getValues()
        Get all the values in the colGroup. Note that this is only the stored values not the way they are stored. Making the output a list of values used in that colGroup not the actual full column.
        Returns:
        a double list of values.

      • getValuesAsBlock

        public abstract MatrixBlock getValuesAsBlock()
        Returns the ColGroup as a MatrixBlock. Used as a fall back solution in case a operation is not supported. Use in connection to getIfCountsType to get if the values are repeated.
        Returns:
        Matrix Block of the contained Values. Possibly contained in groups.

      • getIfCountsType

        public abstract boolean getIfCountsType()
        Returns true if in the getValuesAsBlock method returns values in groups (that needs to be counted) or individually potentially repeated values
        Returns:
        boolean

      • rightMultByVector

        public abstract void rightMultByVector(double[] vector,
                                       double[] c,
                                       int rl,
                                       int ru,
                                       double[] dictVals)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a vector on the right.
        Parameters:
        vector - Vector to multiply by (tall vector)
        c - Accumulator for holding the result
        rl - Row to start at
        ru - Row to stop at
        dictVals - The dictionary values materialized

      • rightMultByMatrix

        public abstract void rightMultByMatrix(double[] preAggregatedB,
                                       double[] c,
                                       int thatNrColumns,
                                       int rl,
                                       int ru,
                                       int cl,
                                       int cu)
        Right multiply by matrix. for which the compressed matrix is on the left and the uncompressed is on the right. Note that there is no b argument, but the b is aggregated into the values needed for assignment and addition into output.
        Parameters:
        preAggregatedB - The preAggregated values that is to be put into c
        c - The output matrix
        thatNrColumns - The number of columns in B (before aggregation)
        rl - The row index to start the multiplication from
        ru - The row index to stop the multiplication at
        cl - The column index to start from
        cu - The row index to stop at.

      • rightMultBySparseMatrix

        public abstract void rightMultBySparseMatrix(SparseRow[] rows,
                                             double[] c,
                                             int numVals,
                                             double[] dictVals,
                                             int nrColumns,
                                             int rl,
                                             int ru)
        Sparse right multiply by matrix, for which the compressed matrix is on the left and the uncompressed sparse is on the right. This call differ from the other right multiply by not having a preAggregation phase. This should only be called in very sparse situations.
        Parameters:
        rows - The sparse rows
        c - The output matrix linearized
        numVals - The number of values in the dictionary
        dictVals - The materialized dictionary
        nrColumns - The number of columns in the matrix to multiply with and also in the output
        rl - The row index to start at
        ru - The row index to stop at.

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result,
                                         int numVals)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - row vector
        result - matrix block result
        numVals - The Number of values contained in the Column.

      • leftMultByRowVector

        public abstract void leftMultByRowVector(double[] vector,
                                         double[] result,
                                         int numVals,
                                         double[] values)
        Multiply the slice of the matrix that this column group represents by a row vector on the left (the original column vector is assumed to be transposed already i.e. its size now is 1xn).
        Parameters:
        vector - row vector
        result - matrix block result
        numVals - The Number of values contained in the Column.
        values - The materialized list of values contained in the dictionary.

      • leftMultByMatrix

        public abstract void leftMultByMatrix(double[] matrix,
                                      double[] result,
                                      double[] values,
                                      int numRows,
                                      int numCols,
                                      int rl,
                                      int ru,
                                      int vOff)
        Multiply with a matrix on the left.
        Parameters:
        matrix - matrix to left multiply
        result - matrix block result
        values - The materialized list of values contained in the dictionary.
        numRows - The number of rows in the matrix input
        numCols - The number of columns in the colGroups parent matrix.
        rl - The row to start the matrix multiplication from
        ru - The row to stop the matrix multiplication at.
        vOff - The offset into the first argument matrix to start at.

      • leftMultBySparseMatrix

        public abstract void leftMultBySparseMatrix(int spNrVals,
                                            int[] indexes,
                                            double[] sparseV,
                                            double[] result,
                                            int numVals,
                                            double[] values,
                                            int numRows,
                                            int numCols,
                                            int row,
                                            double[] MaterializedRow)
        Multiply with a sparse matrix on the left hand side, and add the values to the output result
        Parameters:
        spNrVals - the Number of sparse values (since the number of indexes does not align with number of values)
        indexes - the indexes for the sparse values in the given row.
        sparseV - the sparse values.
        result - the linearized output matrix
        numVals - the number of values in the dictionary
        values - the dictionary values materialized
        numRows - the number of rows in the left hand side input matrix (the sparse one)
        numCols - the number of columns in the compression.
        row - the row index of the sparse row to multiply with.
        MaterializedRow - The sparse row materialized (should only be done if needed for the specific type of ColumnGroup)

      • scalarOperation

        public abstract ColGroup scalarOperation(ScalarOperator op)
        Perform the specified scalar operation directly on the compressed column group, without decompressing individual cells if possible.
        Parameters:
        op - operation to perform
        Returns:
        version of this column group with the operation applied

      • binaryRowOp

        public abstract ColGroup binaryRowOp(BinaryOperator op,
                                     double[] v,
                                     boolean sparseSafe)
        Perform a binary row operation.
        Parameters:
        op - The operation to execute
        v - The vector of values to apply, should be same length as dictionary length.
        sparseSafe - True if the operation return 0 on all instances of values in v -- op(v[?], 0)
        Returns:
        A updated column group with the new values.

      • unaryAggregateOperations

        public abstract void unaryAggregateOperations(AggregateUnaryOperator op,
                                              double[] c)
        Unary Aggregate operator, since aggregate operators require new object output, the output becomes an uncompressed matrix.
        Parameters:
        op - The operator used
        c - Rhe output matrix block.

      • unaryAggregateOperations

        public abstract void unaryAggregateOperations(AggregateUnaryOperator op,
                                              double[] c,
                                              int rl,
                                              int ru)
        Unary Aggregate operator, since aggregate operators require new object output, the output becomes an uncompressed matrix.
        Parameters:
        op - The operator used
        c - The output matrix block.
        rl - The Starting Row to do aggregation from
        ru - The last Row to do aggregation to (not included)

      • getIterator

        public abstract Iterator<IJV> getIterator(int rl,
                                          int ru,
                                          boolean inclZeros,
                                          boolean rowMajor)
        Create a column group iterator for a row index range.
        Parameters:
        rl - row lower index, inclusive
        ru - row upper index, exclusive
        inclZeros - include zero values into scope of iterator
        rowMajor - use a row major iteration order
        Returns:
        an iterator instance

      • getRowIterator

        public abstract org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.colgroup.ColGroup.ColGroupRowIterator getRowIterator(int rl,
                                                                                                       int ru)
        Create a dense row iterator for a row index range. This iterator implies the inclusion of zeros and row-major iteration order.
        Parameters:
        rl - row lower index, inclusive
        ru - row upper index, exclusive
        Returns:
        an iterator instance

      • countNonZerosPerRow

        public abstract void countNonZerosPerRow(int[] rnnz,
                                         int rl,
                                         int ru)
        Count the number of non-zeros per row
        Parameters:
        rnnz - non-zeros per row
        rl - row lower bound, inclusive
        ru - row upper bound, exclusive

      • isLossy

        public abstract boolean isLossy()
        Is Lossy
        Returns:
        returns if the ColGroup is compressed in a lossy manner.
